snippet: Whether or not trustees have a duty to protect investors in mortgage cases is at the center of a multibillion dollar settlement struck by Bank of America for loans made by Countrywide Financial.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column holds that whether or not trustees have a duty to protect investors in mortgage cases is at the center of an $8.5 billion settlement struck by Bank of America for loans made by Countrywide Financial; points out testimony indicates Bank of New York Mellon did not do all it could to ensure investors got best deal from Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Whether or not trustees have a duty to protect investors in mortgage cases is at the center of a multibillion dollar settlement struck by Bank of America for loans made by Countrywide Financial.

headline.main: Who Has Your Back? Hard to Tell
headline.print_headline: Who Has Your Back? Hard to Tell

keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
